author: , The Northwest Florida Daily News
title: DeSantis declares Florida state of emergency for Gulf storm 97L
text: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis declares state of emergency ahead of Gulf storm 'Invest 97L' Florida's governor declared 54 of Florida's 67 counties under a state of emergency. Gov. Ron DeSantis put the vast majority of Florida counties in a state of emergency in preparation [for the potential landfall of a storm](https://www.jacksonville.com/story/weather/hurricane/2024/08/01/tropics-watch-tracker-florida-weekend-impact-tropical-storm-debby-national-hurricane-center/74621244007/) that could become the first "significant threat" to the state in what is expected to [be a violent hurricane season.](https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/2024/05/22/atlantic-hurricane-season-forecast-twice-average-number-storms-5-8-major-hurricanes-2-us-landfalls/73769565007/) "Based on meteorological reports, there [is significant threat of heavy rainfal](https://www.jacksonville.com/story/weather/hurricane/2024/08/01/tropical-storm-debby-spaghetti-models-update-florida/74631023007/)l over most of the State of Florida, with the possibility of at least 12 inches of rainfall over the next seven days," reads the Thursday evening executive order. "The water tables in the affected areas are already nearing peak capacity and incoming heavy rainfall will cause significant river flooding that may last for several weeks." The [counties under a state of emergency](https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/local/state/2024/08/01/florida-price-gouging-hotline-activated-as-gulf-storm-97l-approaches-tropical-storm-hurricane-debby/74640665007/): Alachua, Baker, Bay, Bradford, Calhoun, Charlotte, Citrus, Clay, Collier, Columbia, Dixie, Duval, Escambia, Flagler, Franklin, Gadsden, Gilchrist, Gulf, Hamilton, Hernando, Hillsborough, Holmes, Jackson, Jefferson, Lafayette, Lake, Lee, Leon, Levy, Liberty, Madison, Manatee, Marion, Monroe, Nassau, Okaloosa, Orange, Osceola, Pasco, Pinellas, Polk, Putnam, Santa Rosa, Sarasota, Seminole, St. Johns, Sumter, Suwannee, Taylor, Union, Volusia, Wakulla, Walton, and Washington. No Gouging: : [Florida's attorney general activates price gouging hotline ahead of Gulf storm Invest 97L](https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/local/state/2024/08/01/florida-price-gouging-hotline-activated-as-gulf-storm-97l-approaches-tropical-storm-hurricane-debby/74640665007/) In a [Thursday afternoon advisory](https://www.tallahassee.com/story/weather/hurricanes/2024/08/01/potential-tropical-storm-path-shifts-toward-gulf-of-mexico/74630154007/), the National Hurricane Center said there's a 70% chance that a well-defined tropical wave — designated [Invest 97L](https://www.tallahassee.com/story/weather/hurricanes/2024/08/01/invest-97l-spaghetti-models-gulf-coast/74633466007/) — could develop into a tropical depression in the week near Florida or over the eastern Gulf of Mexico. The [NHC said](https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/gtwo.php?basin=atlc&fdays=2) there's a 30% chance it develops in the next 48 hours. If the storm does develop into a tropical depression and reaches sustained windspeeds of 39 mph, it would become [Tropical Storm Debby](https://www.tallahassee.com/story/weather/hurricanes/2024/07/31/tropical-wave-in-atlantic-could-eye-gulf-coast-if-it-stays-weak/74625513007/). [Declaring a state of emergency](https://www.palmbeachpost.com/story/news/state/2021/08/25/state-emergency-florida-what-happens-when-governor-declares-one/8162488002/) allows state and local governments much more freedom to coordinate their emergency agencies, relax restrictions, cut through red tape and reallocate resources to quickly deal with an imminent or ongoing threat that local services can't handle on their own.
